Description: Network or SaaS client ID. In self-hosted deployments this is fixed at 1(TN). In SaaS platform, different ad networks (clients) receive unique nids.
Type of record: IMP (impression on page load or user event), View (viewed), Link (click), Lead (conversion/acquisition), Blk (blocked request), Vbty (viewability pixel), Noad (no ad served).
Unique GUID for every pixel record. Used for downstream processing.
GUID generated at request-time when an ad is selected. This ID is carried through the entire pipeline to stitch impression ? click ? conversion events.
Transaction ID supplied by an external system (DSP, SSP, partner).
ID assigned to the SSP (e.g., Media.net). When this is present, publisher_id is set to -1
Internal ID for requests coming from fixed network (PAM). When this is present, traffic_source_id is set to 1
Sub-property or subsection of a publisher. Represents the specific section of the publisher’s website/app.
Widget ID or smallest unit of ad inventory. All fixed-network optimization happens at this level.
Maps to a zone table that stores the ad slot dimensions. Native units are responsive, but still mapped.
Site ID sent by the SSP (their publisher ID). Used for SSP optimization and fraud detection.
SSP-defined ad space or widget ID. Used for optimization and fraud detection.
Full URL of the page where the ad was served. If request is from an app, this is the app bundle ID.
Parsed domain from the URL.
Unique value injected by publisher per ad request. Used heavily by fixed-network optimizer.
Categories or keywords matched during contextual targeting.
Categories or keywords extracted from page content.
Code mapped to browser name (Chrome, Safari, Firefox).
Operating system code. Derived from UA.
Cellular or ISP provider derived from IP.
Manufacturer of device (Apple, Samsung).
Device model.
Raw user-agent string. Used to extract make, model, browser, OS.
ID of the advertiser(s) tied to the ads in the slot. Stored as an ordered array because widgets can show multiple ads. Sequence is critical and never shuffled.
Campaign ID corresponding to each advertiser.
Creative / banner / ad ID.
Display, video, native, etc (mapped to integer codes).
Payment model: 2 = CPC, 1 = CPM
Placeholder for future rule-based ad serving.
Number of ads returned in the transaction.
What the advertiser is charged for the event (based on paytype).
What the publisher earns for the event.
Bid amount used for SSP auctions; always 0 for fixed network.
Cost of third-party data (e.g., IQVIA HCP identification). Often rolled into media cost. Not tracked for fixed network.
Redundant and typically unused.
Conversion-level payout passed by advertiser (CPA events).
Cohort or audience segment ID associated with the ad request. Campaigns may map to multiple list_ids.
Authenticated NPI ID from an external partner (e.g., IQVIA NPI number).
Internal cookie ID dropped during impression. Appears back in SSP bidstream as buyer_id.
DSP endpoints involved for programmatic buying.
Response codes from DSP calls.
Bids returned by DSP.
ISO country.
City name.
DMA market code.
State or region.
Timezone.
ISO2 and ISO3 country codes.
Continent code.
Coordinates.
ZIP/postal code.
Full country name.
Flag set once event is included in billing run.
Flag if request was marked fraudulent.
Platform or environment identifier.
